solution_line_template: The total number of fruits that Kannon ate last is {apples_last_night} apples+{banana_last_night} banana+{oranges_last_night} oranges = <<{apples_last_night}+{banana_last_night}+{oranges_last_night}={fruits_last_night}>>{fruits_last_night}
Since last night Kannon had {apples_last_night} apples, today she'll eat {apples_last_night}+{more_apples_today} = <<{apples_last_night}+{more_apples_today}={apples_today}>>{apples_today} apples.

She is also planning to eat {banana_multiplier_today} times as many bananas as she ate last night, a total of {banana_last_night}*{banana_multiplier_today} = <<{bananas_today}={bananas_today}>>{bananas_today} bananas.

Kannon will also eat twice as many oranges as apples she'll have today, which means she'll eat {apples_today}*{orange_multiplier_today} = <<{apples_today}*{orange_multiplier_today}={oranges_today}>>{oranges_today} oranges.
Tonight Kannon will eat {oranges_today} oranges+{bananas_today} bananas +{apples_today} apples = <<{oranges_today}+{bananas_today}+{apples_today}={fruits_tonight}>>{fruits_tonight} fruits
In total, after tonight, Kannon would have eaten {fruits_tonight}+{fruits_last_night} = <<{fruits_tonight}+{fruits_last_night}={total_fruits_two_meals}>>{total_fruits_two_meals} fruits.
